byline.contributor: Michael J. de la Merced, Nick Wingfield, John Koblin, Nick Madigan and Andrew Ross Sorkin contributed reporting.

abstract: Gawker Media files for bankruptcy and puts itself up for action amid financial pressure from $140 million legal judgment in invasion-of-privacy lawsuit by former wrestler Hulk Hogan and war with Silicon Valley billionaire Peter Thiel, who is funding legal cases against online media company; became successful publication by relentlessly and gleefully chronicling lives of powerful, but many say company went too far, often publishing embarrassing items with little news value.

headline.print_headline: In Bankruptcy, Gawker Offers Itself for Sale
headline.main: Gawker, Filing for Bankruptcy After Hulk Hogan Suit, Is for Sale

snippet: The company’s decision to sell itself came just weeks after it was revealed that the Silicon Valley billionaire Peter Thiel financially supported Mr. Hogan’s lawsuit.
